statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Penn 69, Columbia 67
article.story: PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- Tyler Bernardini's baseline jumper with 0.6 seconds left lifted Penn to a 69-67 victory over Columbia in an Ivy League game Saturday night. Kevin Egee shot 4-for-4 from 3-point range and led the Quakers (12-18, 7-6) with 16 points.. Ben Nwachukwu scored 23 points on 9-for-11 shooting and grabbed nine rebounds to lead Columbia (14-15, 7-7). John Baumann, the leading scorer in the Ivy League this season, closed out his career at Columbia with 17 points. Columbia quickly erased its 33-32 halftime deficit and held the lead for most of the second half before Penn started its rally from a 60-54 deficit with 5:06 remaining. Andreas Schreiber hit four consecutive free throws and a jumper to give Penn a 64-62 lead with 2:07 remaining. Columbia rebounded and tied the score at 67-all on a jumper by Niko Scott with 15 seconds remaining, setting up Bernardini's winner. The Lions squandered their chance to deal Penn back-to-back Ivy League losses at home for the first time in 40 years. Instead, Columbia finished 14-15 and missed out on its opportunity chance to post consecutive winning season for the first time in 15 years.
